intro: Scleranthus wollmarii, commonly known as the Wollmar's thornweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a serrated edge, while the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Scleranthus wollmarii is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of soil conditions in its habitat.
